translation.en: 'Did not I offend him in some way?' he asked himself.

translation.ru: -- Ну что ж, как дела? -- сказал он, желая разговориться и не зная, что сказать.
translation.en: 'Well, how are things?' said he, wishing to start a conversation, but not knowing what to say.

translation.ru: Какое жалкое лицо!-- спросил он, заметив сидевшего на лавочке невысокого больного в коричневом пальто и белых панталонах, делавших странные складки на лишенных мяса костях его ног.
translation.en: Who is that? What a pitiful face,' he said, noticing an invalid of medium height who sat on a bench in a brown coat and white trousers which fell into strange folds over his emaciated legs.

translation.ru: Анна ничего не могла придумать, но сердце ее прямо отзывалось на каждое слово, на каждое выражение лица невестки.
translation.en: Anna could not think of anything, but her heart responded to every word and every look of Dolly's.

translation.ru: -- Да о чем мы? -- сказал он, ужаснувшись пред выражением ее отчаянья и опять перегнувшись к ней и взяв ее руку и целуя ее. -- За что?
translation.en: 'But what is it all about?' he said, horrified at her expression of despair, and again leaning toward her he took her hand and kissed it. 'What have I done?

translation.ru: Анна вопросительно взглянула ей в глаза и испуганно покраснела.
translation.en: Anna looked inquiringly into her eyes and blushed with alarm.

translation.ru: -- А я прошу вас объявить, почему я не должна ехать.
translation.en: 'And I beg you will explain why I should not go.'

translation.ru: Ты самый коренной наш, -- сказал полковой командир.
translation.en: You are one of our very own!' said the Commander.

translation.ru: Алексей Александрович думал тотчас стать в те холодные отношения, в которых он должен был быть с братом жены, против которой он начинал дело развода; но он не рассчитывал на то море добродушия, которое выливалось из берегов в душе Степана Аркадьича.
translation.en: Karenin had expected to enter at once upon the cool relation in which he would henceforth stand toward the brother of the wife against whom he was beginning divorce proceedings; but he had not counted upon the flood of kindliness which overflowed the banks of Oblonsky's soul.

translation.ru: -- Нет, не теперь, после!-- сказал он.
translation.en: 'No, not now, later!' he said.

translation.ru: Они пересуживали тех, кого ожидали, и разговор остановился на Лизе Меркаловой.
translation.en: They passed in review all who were expected to come, and their conversation dwelt at some length on Lisa Merkalova.

translation.ru: И вдруг совершенно другая, не боль, а общая мучительная внутренняя неловкость заставила его забыть на мгновение боль зуба. При взгляде на тендер и на рельсы, под влиянием разговора с знакомым, с которым он не встречался после своего несчастия, ему вдруг вспомнилась она, то есть то, что оставалось еще от нее, когда он, как сумасшедший, вбежал в казарму железнодорожной станции: на столе казармы бесстыдно растянутое посреди чужих окровавленное тело, еще полное недавней жизни; закинутая назад уцелевшая голова с своими тяжелыми косами и вьющимися волосами на висках, и на прелестном лице, с полуоткрытым румяным ртом, застывшее странное, жалкое в губах и ужасное в остановившихся незакрытых глазах, выражение, как бы словами выговаривавшее то страшное слово -- о том, что он раскается, -- которое она во время ссоры сказала ему.
translation.en: At the sight of the tender and the rails, and under the influence of conversation with some one he had not met since the catastrophe, he suddenly remembered her; that is, remembered what was left of her when; like a madman, he ran into the railway shed where on a table, stretched out shamelessly before the eyes of strangers, lay the mangled body still warm with recent life. The head, left intact, with its heavy plaits and the curls round the temples, was thrown back; and on the lovely face with its half-open red lips was frozen an expression – pitiful on the lips and horrible in the fixed open eyes – an expression which repeated, as if in words, the terrible phrase about his repenting it – which she had uttered during their quarrel.

translation.ru: Почему должно иметь доверие, то есть полную уверенность в том, что его молодая жена всегда будет его любить, он себя не спрашивал; но он не испытывал недоверия, потому имел доверие и говорил себе, что надо его иметь.
translation.en: Why he should have confidence – that is, a full conviction that his young wife would always love him – he never asked himself; but he felt no distrust, and therefore had confidence, and assured himself that it was right to have it.

translation.ru: Ты презираешь это, и прекрасно, и ступай с богом, ступай!-- кричал он, вставая со стула, -- и ступай, и ступай!
translation.en: You despise it, well, that is all right – then go away. Go, go in God's name!' he exclaimed, rising from his chair.

translation.ru: Вошел Тушкевич, объявив, что все общество ждет игроков в крокет.
translation.en: Tushkevich came in to say that everybody was waiting for the croquet players.

translation.ru: Но доктор и не думал смеяться.
translation.en: But the doctor had no idea of laughing.

translation.ru: -- Ну да, ну да, -- говорила Дарья Александровна, слушая те самые аргументы, которые она сама себе приводила, и не находя в них более прежней убедительности.
translation.en: 'Well, yes, of course,' said Dolly, listening to the very arguments which she had put to herself but not finding them so convincing as before.

translation.ru: Левин едва помнил свою мать.
translation.en: Levin could scarcely remember his mother.

translation.ru: -- Вот он, -- сказал старый князь, указывая на Левина, -- он тут главное лицо.
translation.en: 'Here he is,' said the old Prince, pointing to Levin. 'He is the principal person concerned.'

translation.ru: Меня?
translation.en: Me?

translation.ru: Либеральная партия говорила, или, лучше, подразумевала, что религия есть только узда для варварской части населения, и действительно, Степан Аркадьич не мог вынести без боли в ногах даже короткого молебна и не мог понять, к чему все эти страшные и высокопарные слова о том свете, когда и на этом жить было бы очень весело., Вместе с этим Степану Аркадьичу, любившему веселую шутку, было приятно иногда озадачить смирного человека тем, что если уже гордиться породой, то не следует останавливаться на Рюрике и отрекаться от первого родоначальника -- обезьяны.
translation.en: The Liberal Party said, or rather hinted, that religion was only good as a check on the more barbarous portion of the population; and Oblonsky really could not stand through even a short church service without pain in his feet, nor understand why one should use all that dreadful high-flown language about another world while one can live so merrily in this one. Besides, Oblonsky was fond of a pleasant joke, and sometimes liked to perplex a simple-minded man by observing that if you're going to be proud of your ancestry, why stop short at Prince Rurik and repudiate your oldest ancestor – the ape?

translation.ru: У него были холостые вкусы, только с ними он соображался.
translation.en: He had the tastes of a bachelor and understood no others.

translation.ru: -- Было четверо, двое осталось: мальчик и девочка.
translation.en: 'I had four; two are left, a boy and a girl.

translation.ru: Его мороз пробирал по спине, когда он начинал думать о всех этих подробностях.
translation.en: A cold shudder crept down his back when he began to think of those details.

translation.ru: Да?
translation.en: Yes?'

translation.en: 'Well, and has Papa done what he wanted?'

translation.en: 'Like Prince Yashvin, who considers that Patti sings too loud,' she returned with a smile. 'Thank you!' she said, taking with her small gloved hand a programme Vronsky had picked up for her: and suddenly at that instant her beautiful face quivered.

translation.en: Let me be bad, but at any rate not false, not a humbug!'

translation.en: I would not sleep again after it but go straight from there to the station?'

translation.en: Levin looked round and hardly recognized the place, everything was so altered.

translation.ru: Он помнил все и не считал нужным повторять в своей памяти то, что он скажет.
translation.en: He remembered them all and did not even consider it necessary to go over in his mind what he was going to say.

translation.en: Vronsky felt Karenin's greatness and his own humiliation,. Karenin's rightness and his own wrongdoing.

translation.en: Everything was new, from the new French wall-papers to the carpet which covered the whole floor.

translation.en: This was the Princess Myagkaya, notorious for her simplicity and the roughness of her manners, and nicknamed l'enfant terrible.

translation.en: I'll show it you.

translation.en: She imagined him now calmly conversing with his mother and the Princess Sorokina, and rejoicing at her sufferings.

translation.ru: Ребенка вынули на одной руке из ванны, окатили водой, окутали простыней, вытерли и после пронзительного крика подали матери.
translation.en: The nurse lifted the baby out of the bath with one hand and poured fresh water over him, then he was wrapped up and dried, and after a penetrating yell he was given to his mother.

translation.ru: Он слышал, как его лошади жевали сено, потом как хозяин со старшим малым собирался и уехал в ночное; потом слышал, как солдат укладывался спать с другой стороны сарая с племянником, маленьким сыном хозяина; слышал, как мальчик тоненьким голоском сообщил дяде свое впечатление о собаках, которые казались мальчику страшными и огромными; потом как мальчик расспрашивал, кого будут ловить эти собаки, и как солдат хриплым и сонным голосом говорил ему, что завтра охотники пойдут в болото и будут палить из ружей, и как потом, чтоб отделаться от вопросов мальчика, он сказал: "Спи, Васька, спи, а то смотри", и скоро сам захрапел, и все затихло; только слышно было ржание лошадей и каркание бекаса.
translation.en: He heard his horses chewing hay; then how the master and his eldest son got ready and rode away for the night to pasture their horses; then how the soldier settled down to sleep on the other side of the barn with his nephew, their host's little son; he heard the boy in his treble voice imparting to his uncle his impressions of the dogs, which seemed to him terrible and enormous; then how the boy asked what those dogs were going to catch, and he heard how the soldier replied in a hoarse and sleepy voice that the sportsmen would go next day to the marshes and fire guns, adding, to stop the questioning: 'Sleep, Vaska, sleep, or else look out!' Soon the soldier himself began to snore, and all was still except for the neighing of the horses and the cry of snipe.

translation.ru: Представление, что жена его не пустит, было ему так приятно, что он готов был навсегда отказаться от удовольствия видеть медведей.
translation.en: The idea that his wife would not allow it seemed so agreeable that he was prepared to forgo the pleasure of ever setting eyes on a bear again.

translation.en: 'Oh, Papa! Don't they? And on Sunday, in church?' remarked Dolly, who had been following the conversation. 'Please bring a towel,' she said to the old man, who was looking smilingly at the children. 'It's impossible that all...'

translation.en: He had not the faintest recollection of it, but she was fond of the joke and had laughed at it for the last ten years.

translation.ru: Левин знал тоже, что, возвращаясь домой, надо было прежде всего идти к жене, которая была нездорова; а мужикам, дожидавшимся его уже три часа, можно было еще подождать; и знал, что, несмотря на все удовольствие, испытываемое им при сажании роя, надо было лишиться этого удовольствия и, предоставив старику без себя сажать рой, пойти толковать с мужиками, нашедшими его на пчельнике.
translation.en: Levin knew, too, that on returning home the first thing he must do was to go to his wife, who was unwell, and that the peasants who had been waiting for three hours to see him could wait a little longer; and he knew that in spite of all the pleasure of hiving a swarm, he must forgo that pleasure, let the old beekeeper hive the swarm without him, and go to talk to the peasants who had found him at the apiary.

translation.ru: Она, как он видел, не только не понимала этого дела, но и не хотела понимать.
translation.en: As he saw, she not only did not understand that work but did not wish to understand it.

translation.en: Oh! And did I brush my hair or not?' she asked herself; but could not remember.

translation.ru: "Если так, -- сказал он себе, -- я должен обдумать и решить, а не отдаваться, как мальчик, увлечению минуты".
translation.en: 'If it is so, I must think it over and come to a decision, and not let myself be carried away like a boy by the impulse of the moment,' he told himself.

translation.en: The ploughed land was in excellent condition; it would be possible to harrow and sow it in a couple of days.

translation.ru: Чем больше проходило времени, чем чаще он видел себя опутанным этими сетями, тем больше ему хотелось не то что выйти из них, но попробовать, не мешают ли они его свободе.
translation.en: As time went on, the oftener he felt himself caught in these meshes the more he desired, not exactly to escape from them but to try whether they really interfered with his freedom.

translation.en: She heard Vasily Lukich's step as he came to the door and coughed, and then the steps of the nurse as she entered; but she sat as if turned to stone, powerless to speak or rise.

translation.en: By nothing! – The devil and sin? – And how do I explain evil?...

translation.en: The irritation which divided them had no tangible cause, and all attempts at an explanation not only failed to clear it away but increased it.

translation.ru: Но это сознание своей низости пред тем человеком, которого он несправедливо презирал, составляло только малую часть его горя.
translation.en: But the consciousness of his degradation toward the man whom he had unjustly despised accounted for but a small portion of his grief.

translation.en: In his ears rang incessantly a variety of sounds: now of a busy working bee flying swiftly past, now of a buzzing idle drone, then of the excited bee sentinels guarding their treasure from a foe and prepared to sting.

translation.ru: Неприятнее всего была та первая минута, когда он, вернувшись из театра, веселый и довольный, с огромною грушей для жены в руке, не нашел жены в гостиной; к удивлению, не нашел ее и в кабинете и, наконец, увидал ее в спальне с несчастною, открывшею все, запиской в руке.
translation.en: The worst moment had been when returning home from the theatre merry and satisfied, with an enormous pear in his hand for his wife, he did not find her in the drawing-room nor, to his great surprise, in the study, but at last saw her in her bedroom with the unlucky note which had betrayed him in her hand.

translation.ru: Конторщик, чтобы скрыть свое смущение, суетился, подсаживая дам, но Филипп кучер сделался мрачен и вперед готовился не подчиниться этому внешнему превосходству.
translation.en: The clerk, to hide his embarrassment, bustled about, helping the ladies in, but Philip became morose and made up his mind not to be imposed upon by this eternal superiority.

translation.en: The attendant, an old man, helped him off with his overcoat, recognized him and, addressing him as 'Your Excellency,' suggested that he need not take a ticket for his coat, but should merely call for 'Theodore' when he wanted it.

translation.en: And his brother, commanding one of the most expensive regiments, and newly married, could not refuse this gift.

translation.en: Even the memories, impressions, and thoughts, within his body now aroused in him the same sort of repulsion as the body itself.

translation.en: Just as heretofore, she could hold him only by means of her love and attractiveness; and just as heretofore, only by occupations by day and morphia by night could she stifle the terrible thought of what would happen if he ceased to love her.

translation.en: 'This custom of taking leave of celibacy is not without its reason,' said Sergius Ivanich. 'However happy you may be, you can't help regretting your freedom.'

translation.ru: -- И я уверен в себе, когда вы опираетесь на меня, -- сказал он, но тотчас же испугался того, что сказал, и покраснел.
translation.en: 'And I am confident of myself when you lean on me,' he answered, and was immediately frightened of what he had said, and blushed.

translation.ru: Пойдем, я тебе покажу ее.
translation.en: 'Come! I will show her to you.

translation.ru: Впрочем, делай, что хочешь... И он, отвернувшись от шурина, так чтобы тот не мог видеть его, сел на стул у окна.
translation.en: However, do as you like!' and turning away so that his brother-in-law should not see his face, he sat down on a chair by the window.

translation.ru: И в средине разговора, в средине фразы он вскочил и пошел из комнаты.
translation.en: And in the middle of the conversation, in the middle of a phrase, he suddenly jumped up and left the room.

translation.ru: Но дверь уже отворялась более чем десять раз, и каждый раз это был или запоздавший гость или гостья, присоединявшиеся к кружку званых, направо, или зрительница, обманувшая или умилостивившая полицейского офицера, присоединявшаяся к чужой толпе, налево. И родные и посторонние уже прошли чрез все фазы ожидания.
translation.en: But the door had opened more than ten times and each time it turned out to be a guest who had been detained and now joined the crowd on the right, or a spectator who had managed to deceive or soften the heart of the police officer and who joined the throng of strangers on the left; and both relatives and spectators had passed through every phase of anticipation.

translation.ru: -- Я пришел вам сказать, что я завтра уезжаю в Москву и не вернусь более в этот дом, и вы будете иметь известие о моем решении чрез адвоката, которому я поручу дело развода.
translation.en: 'I have come to tell you that I am going to Moscow tomorrow and shall not return to this house again, and that you will hear my decision through the lawyer whom I shall employ in the divorce suit.

translation.ru: Поднятые руки просили его рук.
translation.en: Her raised hands asked for his.

translation.ru: Только что она сказала это, она поняла, что, как ни любовно он был теперь расположен к ней, он этого не простил ей.
translation.en: As soon as she had said this she knew that, however lovingly disposed he might be to her, he had not forgiven her for that letter.

translation.ru: Стремительность же вперед была такова, что при каждом движении обозначались из-под платья формы колен и верхней части ноги, и невольно представлялся вопрос о том, где сзади, в этой подстроенной колеблющейся горе, действительно кончается ее настоящее, маленькое и стройное, столь обнаженное сверху и столь спрятанное сзади и внизу тело.
translation.en: At each strenuous step as she advanced, the shape of her knees and thighs was distinctly visible under her dress, and one involuntarily wondered just where, behind, under her heaped and swaying bustle, the real, graceful little body ended which was so exposed at the top and so hidden at the back and below.

translation.ru: XXI
translation.en: CHAPTER XXI

translation.ru: Здесь сохранились предания, что вы лучший конькобежец, -- сказала она, стряхивая маленькою ручкой в черной перчатке иглы инея, упавшие на муфту.
translation.en: There is a tradition here that you are the best skater,' she said, flicking off with a small black-gloved hand some hoar-frost crystals that had fallen on her muff.

translation.ru: Вернувшись в свой вагон, он не переставая перебирал все положения, в которых ее видел, все ее слова, и в его воображении, заставляя замирать сердце, носились картины возможного будущего.
translation.en: When he returned to the train, he kept recalling all the positions in which he had seen her, and all her words; and in his imagination, causing his heart to stand still, floated pictures of a possible future.

translation.ru: "И как они все сильны и здоровы физически, -- подумал Алексей Александрович, глядя на могучего с расчесанными душистыми бакенбардами камергера и на красную шею затянутого в мундире князя, мимо которых ему надо было пройти. -- Справедливо сказано, что все в мире есть зло", -- подумал он, косясь еще раз на икры камергера.
translation.en: 'How strong and healthy they all are physically,' he thought, glancing at the powerfully-built chamberlain with his well-brushed and perfumed whiskers, and at the red neck of a Prince in a tightly-fitting uniform, whom he had to pass on his way. 'It is truly said that everything in the world is sin,' he thought, again glancing out of the corners of his eyes at the chamberlain's calves.

translation.en: 'Where am I?

translation.en: I was living on my estate and he was with me.

translation.en: The peasant behind him was still mowing but was obviously tired too, for he stopped without coming even with Levin and began whetting his scythe.

translation.en: He paused at the drawing-room door.

translation.en: On entering the drawing-room Oblonsky made his excuses, explaining that he had been kept by the particular Prince who was his usual scapegoat whenever he was late or absent, and in a moment he had reintroduced everybody, and having brought Karenin and Koznyshev together, he started them off on the subject of the Russification of Poland, and they immediately caught on, Pestsov joining them.

translation.en: 'Yes, and I used to hear about you, but not only from your wife,' said Vronsky, checking the hint by a serious look. 'I am very glad of your success but not at all surprised.

translation.en: 'Well, if that is its aim, I'd rather be a savage.'

translation.en: Petritsky, still singing, winked his eyes and pouted as if to say, 'We know what sort of Bryansky it is.'

translation.ru: -- Я не могу допустить, -- сказал Сергей Иванович с обычною ему ясностью и отчетливостью выражения и изяществом дикции, -- я не могу ни в каком случае согласиться с Кейсом, чтобы все мое представление о внешнем мире вытекало из впечатлений.
translation.en: 'I cannot admit,' said Koznyshev with his usual clear and precise expression and polished style, 'I cannot on any account agree with Keiss that my whole conception of the external world is the outcome of impressions.

translation.en: Oblonsky had more than once experienced this kind of acute estrangement instead of union following a dinner with a friend, and knew what to do in such a case.

translation.en: Oh yes, Darmstadt was in America, – and Alabin was giving the party.

translation.en: Is it possible that I can't take it on myself?' she wondered, and began again from the beginning. 'He is truthful, he is honest.

translation.en: 'Why in a village?

translation.en: She will come directly,' Dolly said awkwardly, not knowing how to tell an untruth. 'Oh, here she is!'

translation.en: 'It's a good thing he is so unattractive, and that Kitty has not fallen in love with him,' thought her mother.

translation.en: 'I don't think so,' said Sviyazhsky, now quite serious. 'All I see is that we do not know how to farm, and that our farming in the days of serfdom was not at too high but on the contrary at too low a level.

translation.en: Vronsky took Mikhaylov's part, but in the depth of his heart he believed what Golenishchev said, for he considered that a man of that other and lower world must envy him.

translation.en: He sat through the first two acts and saw everybody that it was necessary for him to see.

translation.en: Of course off they go after her, galloping full speed.

translation.en: 'In general, I see that your journey has been a success,' said he.

translation.en: Every one might know or suspect, but no one must dare to speak about the matter, or he was prepared to silence the speaker and make him respect the non-existent honour of the woman he loved.

translation.en: Only occasionally, in the stillness, he listened to the clicking of her needles and, remembering what he did not wish to remember, made a wry face.

translation.en: 'Why impossible?' said Anna, forcing back her tears and clearly no longer attaching any importance to what he would say.

translation.ru: XVII
translation.en: CHAPTER XVII

translation.en: Find out whether my carriage has come,' said Oblonsky to a footman.

translation.en: They will not give him to me.

translation.en: All this pleased him, but it had already pleased him so often!

translation.en: 'It's all your fault! Your fault!' she exclaimed with tears of despair and spite in her voice, and rose.

translation.en: The elegant servant with the whiskers, who often complained to his friends about the weakness of his nerves, was so upset when he saw his master lying on the floor, that he left him to bleed to death and ran away to get help.

translation.en: All this was untimely and foolish, and Levin himself was conscious of it even while he spoke.

translation.en: You wouldn't believe how uncomfortable' – he put special emphasis on the word uncomfortable – 'it is to dine alone!'

translation.en: After a few sips she glanced at him, and from the expression of his face clearly realized that her hand, her movement, and the sound made by her lips were repulsive to him.

translation.en: Please give her my love...

translation.en: 'As you please,' said the carpenter, his eyes suddenly brightening; evidently he had at last understood. 'It seems we'll have to make another.'

translation.en: The spot where she stood seemed to him an unapproachable sanctuary, and there was a moment when he nearly went away, he was so filled with awe.

translation.en: Well then, would you like me not to see anybody?'

translation.ru: Алексей Александрович, увидав слезы Вронского, почувствовал прилив того душевного расстройства, которое производил в нем вид страданий других людей, и, отворачивая лицо, он, не дослушав его слов, поспешно пошел к двери.
translation.en: The sight of Vronsky's tears made Karenin aware of the approach of that mental perturbation which other people's visible sufferings always aroused in him, and turning away his head he went toward the door without heeding what Vronsky was saying.

translation.en: He was about to cover his picture, but paused, and holding up the sheet stood a long time with a rapturous smile gazing at the figure of John.

translation.ru: Васенька Весловский, ее муж и даже Свияжский и много людей, которых она знала, никогда не думали об этом и верили на слово тому, что всякий порядочный хозяин желает дать почувствовать своим гостям, именно, что все, что так хорошо у него устроено, не стоило ему, хозяину, никакого труда, а сделалось само собой.
translation.en: Vasenka Veslovsky, her husband, and even Sviyazhsky and many others whom she knew, never thought about these things, and readily believed, what every decent host wishes his guests to feel, that all that is so well arranged at his house has cost him no trouble but has come about of itself.

translation.ru: Вспоминал он, как брат в университете и год после университета, несмотря на насмешки товарищей, жил как монах, в строгости исполняя все обряды религии, службы, посты и избегая всяких удовольствий, в особенности женщин; и потом как вдруг его прорвало, он сблизился с самыми гадкими людьми и пустился в самый беспутный разгул.
translation.en: He recalled how despite the ridicule of his fellow-students his brother had lived like a monk while at the University and for a year after, strictly observing all the religious rites, attending service, fasting, avoiding all pleasures and especially women; and then how he suddenly broke loose, became intimate with the vilest people and gave himself up to unbridled debauchery.

translation.en: 'Besides, what can I write to him?' she asked herself; and again she blushed with shame.

translation.en: 'In that case, better not study them.'

translation.en: Nevedovsky pretended not merely to be indifferent to but to despise this title; but it was evident that he felt happy and exercised self-control to avoid betraying a delight ill-suited to the new Liberal circle in which they found themselves.

translation.en: In October there were the Nobility elections in the Kashin Province, in which Vronsky's, Sviyazhsky's, Koznyshev's, and also a small part of Levin's estates were situated.

translation.en: Your brother and another gentleman have come!'

translation.en: It was still quite light out of doors, but in the Countess Lydia Ivanovna's small drawing-room the blinds were down and the lamp alight.

translation.en: What else makes people go mad? What makes them shoot themselves?' he replied to his own thought; and opening his eyes he was surprised to see, close to his head, an embroidered cushion worked by Varya, his brother's wife.

translation.en: In the wealthy Province of Kashin, always ahead of all others, such forces were now assembled that, if matters were here managed as they should be, it might serve as an example to other Provinces and to the whole of Russia.

translation.en: He had understood what 'If it is possible' meant. It meant, if it is possible to arrange the divorce so that she should have her son...

translation.en: 'I am so glad!' answered Dolly, smiling, but in a colder tone than she intended. 'I am very glad for your sake.

translation.en: 'All this may be very good, but why should I trouble about medical centres which I should never use or schools to which I should never send my children, and to which the peasants would not wish to send theirs either? – and to which I am not fully convinced they ought to send them?' said he.

translation.en: It was all a lie: a repulsive, insulting, blasphemous lie; and as a result of his character, and because he loved the dying man more than the others did, Levin felt that lie most painfully.

translation.en: 'I am a poor judge,' he replied, looking severely at her.

translation.en: He was glad of this opportunity to be alone and recover from reality, which had already so lowered his spiritual condition.

translation.en: Oblonsky was in low spirits, a thing that rarely happened to him, and could not fall asleep for a long time.

translation.en: It was agreeable because there was still hope for him, and even more because she was suffering, she who had made him suffer so much.

translation.en: Leaving his tea and regretting the interruption in the interesting conversation, yet uneasy as to why he was sent for, as this only happened on important occasions; Levin went to the nursery.

translation.en: 'I do, but I can't begin to speak about it, – by which you can judge whether my guess is right or wrong,' said Oblonsky, looking at him with a subtle smile.

Добрая улыбка была так убедительна, что невольно Алексей Александрович, чувствуя свою слабость и подчиняясь ей, готов был верить тому, что скажет Степан Аркадьич. -- Она никогда не выскажет этого.
translation.en: 'If you wish to know my opinion,' said Oblonsky with the same soothing, almondy-tender smile with which he had addressed Anna – a kindly smile so convincing that Karenin, conscious of his own weakness and yielding to it, was involuntarily ready to believe anything Oblonsky should say, – 'she would never say so, but there is one way out, one thing she might wish!

translation.en: The result was some confusion, whispering, and smiles, but the expression of solemn emotion on the young couple's faces did not change; on the contrary, while they fumbled with their hands they looked even more solemn and serious than before, and the smile with which Oblonsky whispered to them to put on their rings involuntarily died on his lips.

translation.en: Since their talk about religion during their engagement neither he nor she had ever started a conversation on that subject; but she continued to observe the rites, went to church, and prayed, always with the same quiet conviction that it was necessary to do so.

translation.ru: С той минуты, как при виде любимого умирающего брата Левин в первый раз взглянул на вопросы жизни и смерти сквозь те новые, как он называл их, убеждения, которые незаметно для него, в период от двадцати до тридцати четырех лет, заменили его детские и юношеские верования, -- он ужаснулся не столько смерти, сколько жизни без малейшего знания о том, откуда, для чего, зачем и что она такое.
translation.en: SINCE THE MOMENT when, at the sight of his beloved and dying brother, Levin for the first time looked at the questions of life and death in the light of the new convictions, as he called them, which between the ages of twenty and thirty-four had imperceptibly replaced the beliefs of his childhood and youth, he had been less horrified by death than by life without the least knowledge of whence it came, what it is for, why, and what it is.

translation.en: No one could determine better than he the limits of freedom, simplicity, and formality, necessary for the pleasant transaction of business.

translation.en: And her black velvet with rich lace was not at all conspicuous, but served only as a frame; she alone was noticeable – simple, natural, elegant and at the same time merry and animated.

translation.en: 'I cannot defend his opinions,' said Dolly, flaring up, 'but I can say that he is a very well-informed man, and if he were here he would be able to answer you, though I cannot.'

translation.en: 'Say there will be no answer,' said the Countess Lydia Ivanovna, and at once opened her blotter and wrote to Karenin that she hoped to meet him about one o'clock at the Palace, at the Birthday Reception.

translation.en: 'He fumbles about and mutters French words, so quickly, so quickly, and with a burr, you know: "Il faut le battre, le fer: le broyer, le pétrir..."

translation.en: The good-natured Turovtsyn clearly felt quite out of it, and the smile on his thick lips, with which he met Oblonsky said as clearly as words, 'Well, my friend, you have planted me among the clever ones!

translation.en: And here come the fried eggs, just the way I like them best.

translation.en: 'Mama, is it true?' asked Kitty.

translation.en: 'I'm afraid you are not quite comfortable here,' she said, turning away from his penetrating glance and looking round the room. 'We shall have to ask the landlord for another room, and see that we are nearer to each other,' she said to her husband.

translation.en: Directing her searchlight upon them, Anna thought she saw their story and all the hidden recesses of their souls.

translation.en: For six weeks he spoke to no one and ate only when I implored him to.

translation.en: 'My youngest,' replied the old man with a smile of affection.

translation.ru: Это было то самое, что он ожидал, -- письмо от матери с упреками за то, что он не приезжал, и записка от брата, в которой говорилось, что нужно переговорить.
translation.en: It was just what he had expected: a letter from his mother reproaching him for not having come to see her, and a note from his brother saying that they must talk things over.

translation.ru: И он опять говорил себе в столовой: "Да, это необходимо решить и прекратить и высказать свой взгляд..." И опять в гостиной пред поворотом он спрашивал себя: как решить?
translation.en: And again he repeated to himself in the dining-room: 'Yes, it is necessary to decide, and stop it, and express my opinion...'

translation.ru: Когда Алексей Александрович появился на скачках, Анна уже сидела в беседке рядом с Бетси, в той беседке, где собиралось все высшее общество.
translation.en: WHEN KARENIN APPEARED at the racecourse Anna was already sitting beside Betsy in the Grand Stand: the stand where all the highest Society was assembled.

translation.ru: Мальчик читал, вертя в руке и стараясь оторвать чуть державшуюся пуговицу курточки.
translation.en: The boy, as he read, kept twisting and trying to pull off a loose button that hung from his jacket.

translation.ru: Разговоры с мужиками в дальней деревне показывали, что они начинали привыкать к своим отношениям.
translation.en: His conversation with the peasants of the outlying village showed that they were beginning to get used to the new conditions.

translation.ru: Ты считаешь Вронского аристократом, но я нет.
translation.en: You consider Vronsky an aristocrat. I don't.

translation.ru: Вронский представил гостье доктора и управляющего. Архитектора он познакомил с нею еще в больнице.
translation.en: Vronsky introduced the doctor and the steward to his visitor; the architect had already been presented at the hospital.

translation.ru: -- Ну, что вам, мама!-- напали на нее обе дочери.
translation.en: 'Oh, what an idea, mama!' rejoined both her daughters.

translation.ru: Она хотела упасть под поравнявшийся с ней серединою первый вагон. Но красный мешочек, который она стала снимать с руки, задержал ее, и было уже поздно: середина миновала ее.
translation.en: She wanted to fall half-way between the wheels of the front truck, which was drawing level with her, but the little red handbag which she began to take off her arm delayed her, and then it was too late. The middle had passed her.

translation.ru: Так понимаешь этого человека, доброго, славного малого, но чиновника до глубины души, который не ведает, что творит.
translation.en: One can so well understand that man, a kind, first-rate fellow, but an official to his very backbone, who does not know what he is doing.

translation.ru: Ах! как я глуп...
translation.en: Oh, how stupid I am!'

translation.ru: До обеда еще оставалось много времени, погода была прекрасная, и потому было предложено несколько различных способов провести эти остающиеся два часа.
translation.en: As there was still plenty of time before dinner, and the weather was beautiful, several different ways of passing the next two hours were proposed.

translation.ru: Ничего не ловилось, но Сергей Иванович не скучал и казался в самом веселом расположении духа.
translation.en: Though he had caught nothing, Koznyshev did not feel bored and seemed in the best of spirits.

translation.ru: Мысли эти незаметно для него самого занимали его и в то время, когда он говорил об отдаче земли.
translation.en: These ideas, though he had been unconscious of them, had been in his mind when he was talking about letting the land.

translation.ru: Она все поняла и,не спрашивая его: так ли? взяла мел и тотчас же ответила.
translation.en: She understood it all, and without asking if she was right, took the chalk, and wrote the answer at once.

translation.ru: Себя погубила и двух прекрасных людей -- своего мужа и моего несчастного сына.
translation.en: She ruined herself and two splendid men – her husband and my unfortunate son.'

translation.ru: Левин был почти одних лет с Облонским и с ним на "ты" не по одному шампанскому.
translation.en: Levin and Oblonsky were almost of the same age; and with Levin, Oblonsky was on familiar terms not through champagne only.

translation.ru: Они что-то везли и уронили.
translation.en: They were dragging something along, and had upset it.

translation.ru: -- Я не упрекаю...
translation.en: 'I don't blame...'

translation.ru: Ему стало так весело, что он, противно своим правилам, сделал уступку торговавшейся барыне и перестал ловить моль, окончательно решив, что к будущей зиме надо перебить мебель бархатом, как у Сигонина.
translation.en: He felt so cheerful that, contrary to his custom, he allowed a reduction to the bargaining lady and gave up catching moths, having made up his mind to have his furniture re-covered next winter with velvet, like Sigonin's.

translation.ru: Отец и педагог были оба недовольны Сережей, и действительно он учился очень дурно.
translation.en: His father and the educationalist were both displeased with Serezha, and he really learnt badly.

translation.ru: Она всегда его любила.
translation.en: She always liked him.'

translation.ru: Как ни горько было теперь княгине видеть несчастие старшей дочери Долли, сбиравшейся оставить мужа, волнение о решавшейся судьбе меньшой дочери поглощало все ее чувства.
translation.en: Hard as it was to see the misfortune of Dolly, her eldest daughter (who thought of leaving her husband), the Princess's anxiety as to her youngest daughter's fate, now about to be decided, entirely absorbed her.

translation.ru: Чувство то было давнишнее, знакомое чувство, похожее на состояние притворства, которое она испытывала в отношениях к мужу; но прежде она не замечала этого чувства, теперь она ясно и больно сознала его.
translation.en: It was that ordinary well-known feeling, as if she were dissembling, which she experienced in regard to her husband, but formerly she had not noticed it, while now she was clearly and painfully conscious of it.

translation.ru: Вся жизнь его сливалась в одно чувство страдания и желания избавиться от него.
translation.en: His life was quite swallowed up in a consciousness of suffering and a desire to be released from it.

translation.ru: -- Это хуже жестокости, это подлость, если уже вы хотите знать! -- со взрывом злобы вскрикнула Анна и, встав, хотела уйти.
translation.en: 'It is worse than cruelty, it is – baseness, if you want to know!' Anna exclaimed in a burst of anger, and rose to go.

translation.ru: Правила эти несомненно определяли, -- что нужно заплатить шулеру, а портному не нужно, -- что лгать не надо мужчинам, но женщинам можно, -- что обманывать нельзя никого, но мужа можно, -- что нельзя прощать оскорблений и можно оскорблять и т. д.
translation.en: The code categorically determined that though the card-sharper must be paid, the tailor need not be; that one may not lie to a man, but might to a woman; that one must not deceive anyone, except a husband; that one must not forgive an insult but may insult others, and so on.

translation.ru: Тотчас после обеда приехала Кити.
translation.en: Immediately after dinner Kitty came.

translation.ru: -- Нет.
translation.en: 'No.

translation.ru: -- Я сколько времени бьюсь и ничего не сделал, -- говорил он про свой портрет, -- а он посмотрел и написал.
translation.en: 'How long have I been struggling without accomplishing anything?' he said, referring to the portrait he was painting; 'and he just looked, and painted this!

translation.ru: Кити смотрела, любуясь, на вальсировавшую Анну и слушала его. Она ждала, что он пригласит ее на вальс, но он не пригласил, и она удивленно взглянула на него.
translation.en: Kitty, while gazing with admiration at Anna waltzing, listened to him, expecting him to ask her to waltz, but he did not do so and she glanced at him with surprise.

translation.ru: Кити чувство-- вала, что в ней, в ее складе жизни, она найдет образец того, чего теперь мучительно искала: интересов жизни, достоинства жизни -- вне отвратительных для Кити светских отношений девушки к мужчинам, представлявшихся ей теперь позорною выставкой товара, ожидающего покупателей.
translation.en: She felt that in her and in her way of life could be found a model of what she herself was painfully seeking: interest in life, the worth of life – outside the social relations of girls to men, which now seemed disgusting to Kitty, who regarded them as shameful exhibitions of goods awaiting a buyer.

translation.ru: Я знаю, что родятся детей миллионы без Москвы и докторов... отчего же...
translation.en: I know that millions of children are born without Moscow and without doctors; then why...'

translation.ru: Но Анна поняла.
translation.en: But Anna had understood.

translation.ru: За что?
translation.en: What for?

translation.ru: О своей картине, той, которая стояла теперь на его мольберте, у него в глубине души было одно суждение -- то, что подобной картины никто никогда не писал.
translation.en: About his picture – the one at present on the easel – he had at the bottom of his heart a firm opinion: that no one had ever painted anything like it.

translation.ru: -- Старая знакомая, -- сказала Анна на Аннушку.
translation.en: 'An old acquaintance,' said Anna, pointing to Annushka.

translation.ru: "Один раз увидать ее и потом зарыться, умереть", -- думал он и, делая прощальные визиты, высказал эту мысль Бетси.
translation.en: 'Only to see her once more, and then to bury myself, to die!' he thought, as he was making a round of farewell calls, and he expressed this thought to Betsy.

translation.ru: Главное, что меня тронуло (и тут Анна угадала главное, что могло тронуть Долли)... -- его мучают две вещи: то, что ему стыдно детей, и то, что он, любя тебя... да, да, любя больше всего на свете, -. поспешно перебила она хотевшую возражать Долли, -- сделал тебе больно, убил тебя.
translation.en: What moved me most is... (and here Anna guessed what would touch Dolly most) that two things tormented him. He is ashamed of the children, and that, loving you... yes, yes, loving you more than anything else in the world,' she hurriedly went on, not listening to Dolly who was about to reply, 'he has hurt you, hit you so hard.

translation.ru: В четверг ветер затих, и надвинулся густой серый туман, как бы скрывая тайны совершавшихся в природе перемен.
translation.en: On the Thursday the wind fell and a thick grey mist rose as if to hide the secret of the changes nature was carrying on.

translation.ru: Они отошли так далеко, что никто уже не мог бы слышать их, но он все еще не начинал говорить.
translation.en: They had gone far enough not to be overheard, but he still had not begun.

translation.ru: В Турции был в гареме, в Индии ездил на слоне и теперь в России желал вкусить всех специально русских удовольствий.
translation.en: He had been in a harem in Turkey, ridden an elephant in India, and now in Russia he wanted a taste of distinctive Russian amusements.

translation.ru: -- Боже мой, что я сделал!
translation.en: 'Oh, my God!

translation.ru: -- Нет, папа, он очень милый, и Костя его очень любит, -- как будто упрашивая его о чем-то, улыбаясь, сказала Кити, заметившая выражение насмешливости на лице отца.
translation.en: 'No, Papa, he is very nice, and Kostya is very fond of him,' Kitty replied with a smile as of entreaty, having noticed a sarcastic expression on her father's face.

translation.ru: В то время как Степан Аркадьич заходил за трельяж и говоривший мужской голос замолк, Левин смотрел на портрет, в блестящем освещении выступавший из рамы, и не мог оторваться от него.
translation.en: While Oblonsky passed behind a screen of trellis-work – and the man's voice that had been speaking became silent – Levin looked at the portrait, which in the bright illumination seemed to step out of its frame, and he could not tear himself away from it.

translation.ru: Она сидела в гостиной, под лампой, с новою книгой Тэна и читала, прислушиваясь к звукам ветра на дворе и ожидая каждую минуту приезда экипажа.
translation.en: She was sitting in the drawing-room, reading by lamplight a new book by Taine, listening to the wind outside, and expecting every moment the arrival of the carriage.

translation.ru: Анна, взглянув вниз, узнала тотчас же Вронского, и странное чувство удовольствия и вместе страха чего-то вдруг шевельнулось у нее в сердце.
translation.en: Anna looked down from the landing where she stood and at once recognized Vronsky, and a strange feeling of pleasure mixed with fear suddenly stirred in her heart.

translation.ru: А как дело сделать, так мы лучше всегда сделаем.
translation.en: But when it comes to getting business done, we do it better than anyone.

translation.ru: -- Ну, так вот что мы сделаем: ты поезжай в нашей карете за ним, а Сергей Иванович уже если бы был так добр заехать, а потом послать.
translation.en: 'Then this is what we must do: you go and fetch him in our carriage, and Sergius Ivanich, if he will be so kind, will go first and will send the carriage back.'

translation.ru: Мадам Шталь принадлежала к высшему обществу, но она была такбольна, что не могла ходить, и только в редкие хорошие дни появлялась на водах в колясочке.
translation.en: Madame Stahl belonged to the highest Society, but she was so ill that she could not walk, and only on fine days occasionally appeared on the promenade in a bath-chair.

translation.ru: Левин вернулся в гостиницу и испугался мысли о том, как он один теперь с своим нетерпением проведет остающиеся ему еще десять часов.
translation.en: Levin returned to the hotel and the thought of how with his impatience he would spend the remaining ten hours frightened him.

translation.ru: -- Готова, барин; бреет, сама косит, -- сказал Тит, с улыбкой снимая шапку и подавая ему косу.
translation.en: 'It's ready, master! Like a razor, it will mow of itself,' said Titus, taking off his cap and smiling as he handed the scythe.

translation.ru: -- Вот, ты всегда приписываешь мне дурные, подлые мысли, -- заговорила она со слезами оскорбления и гнева. -- Я ничего, ни слабости, ничего...
translation.en: 'There, you see! You always attribute bad and vile motives to me,' she began, with tears of anger and resentment.

translation.ru: Неспособен.
translation.en: I'm incapable.'

translation.ru: Как ни безнадежен он был, как ни очевидно было при взгляде на него, что он не может выздороветь, Левин и Кити находились этот час в одном и том же счастливом и робком, как бы не ошибиться, возбуждении.
translation.en: Hopeless as his case was, obvious as it was that he could not recover, Levin and Kitty were for that hour both in the same state of excitement, happy yet timid and fearful of being mistaken.

translation.en: 'Duties are connected with rights, power, money, honours: that is what women are seeking,' said Pestsov.

translation.en: 'Not all,' said Dolly. 'You judge by your own husband.

translation.ru: На платформе раздалось Боже, царя храни, потом крики: ура! и живио!
translation.en: On the platform 'God save the Tsar' was struck up, followed by 'hurrah 'and 'zhivio'!

translation.ru: Я скажу, -- просто сказала Варенька и, не дожидаясь ответа, продолжала: -- Да, это воспоминание, и было тяжелое когда-то.
translation.en: I will tell you,' said Varenka simply and without waiting for a reply continued: 'Yes, there is a memory attached to it and it was painful once.

translation.ru: Она покраснела, когда Вронский ввел Голенищева, и эта детская краска, покрывшая ее открытое и красивое лицо, чрезвычайно понравилась ему.
translation.en: She blushed when Vronsky showed Golenishchev in, and the childlike flush that suffused her open and handsome face pleased him exceedingly.

translation.ru: Он пахал под картофель плугою, как он называл плуг, взятый у помещика.
translation.en: He ploughed the land for the potatoes with an English plough, which he had borrowed from a landowner.

translation.ru: Вронский поклонился, и Алексей Александрович, пожевав ртом, поднял руку к шляпе и прошел.
translation.en: Vronsky bowed, and Karenin silently moved his lips, lifted his hand to his hat, and went out.

translation.ru: Зачем свобода?
translation.en: What is the good of freedom?

translation.ru: Он думал, что его сватовство не будет иметь ничего похожего на другие, что обычные условия сватовства испортят его особенное счастье; но кончилось тем, что он делал то же, что другие, и счастье его от этого только увеличивалось и делалось более и более особенным, не имевшим и не имеющим ничего подобного.
translation.en: He had thought that his courtship would be quite unlike any other, that the ordinary conditions of courtship would spoil his peculiar happiness; but he ended by doing what others do, and his happiness was thereby only increased, becoming more and more peculiar to him, unlike anyone else's was or is.

translation.ru: Как глава семьи, я лицо обязанное руководить ею, и потому отчасти лицо ответственное; я должен указать опасность, которую я вижу, предостеречь и даже употребить власть.
translation.en: As head of the family I am the person whose duty it is to guide her, and who is therefore partly responsible; I must show her the danger which I see, warn her, and even use my authority.

translation.ru: Но он не мог сказать дурак, потому что Свияжский был несомненно не только очень умный, но очень образованный и необыкновенно просто носящий свое образование человек.
translation.en: But he could not call him a fool because Sviyazhsky was not only very intelligent but also a very well-educated man, who carried his education with extreme modesty.

translation.ru: Это ты знаешь, -- настолько ли есть, чтобы можно было простить.
translation.en: I do not know how much love there still is in your soul – you alone know that. Is there enough for forgiveness?

translation.ru: Сергей Иванович говорил с Дарьей Дмитриевной, шутя уверяя ее, что обычай уезжать после свадьбы распространяется потому, что новобрачным всегда бывает несколько совестно.
translation.en: Koznyshev was talking to Dolly, jokingly assuring her that the custom of going away after the wedding was spreading because newly-married couples always felt rather uncomfortable.

translation.ru: Анна была более, чем к другим, ласкова к нему и благодарна за свой портрет.
translation.en: Anna was even kinder to him than to others, and was grateful for her portrait.

translation.ru: Старые были большею частью или в дворянских старых застегнутых мундирах, со шпагами и шляпами, или в своих особенных, флотских, кавалерийских, пехотных, выслуженных мундирах.
translation.en: The old, for the most part, either wore old-fashioned buttoned-up uniforms of their class and carried swords and hats, or wore the naval, cavalry, or infantry uniforms to which each was individually entitled.

translation.ru: Как только Левин подошел к ванне, ему тотчас же был представлен опыт, и опыт вполне удался.
translation.en: Directly Levin approached the bath he was shown an experiment which succeeded perfectly.

translation.ru: Одно было несомненно, что надо было не мешкать, потому что уже половина седьмого.
translation.en: One thing was certain: there was no time to be lost, for it was already half-past six.

translation.ru: -- Так тем более тебе надо устроить свое положение, если возможно, -- сказала Долли.
translation.en: 'THEN THERE IS ALL THE MORE NEED to regularize your position if possible,' said Dolly.

translation.ru: Главный управляющий готов подписать условие.
translation.en: The steward was ready to sign the contract.

translation.ru: Очнувшись, Левин встал с копны и, оглядев звезды, понял, что прошла ночь.
translation.en: Awaking to reality Levin rose from his haycock, and glancing up at the stars realized that the night was nearly over.

translation.ru: Матвей положил руки в карманы своей жакетки, отставил ногу и молча, добродушно, чуть-чуть улыбаясь, посмотрел на своего барина.
translation.en: Matthew put his hands into the pocket of his jacket, put out his foot, and looked at his master with a slight, good-humoured smile.

translation.ru: -- Долли!-- сказал он тихим, робким голосом. Он втянул голову в плечи и хотел иметь жалкий и покорный вид, но он все-таки сиял свежестью и здоровьем.
translation.en: On seeing her husband she thrust her arms into a drawer of the wardrobe as if looking for something, and only when he had come close to her did she turn her face toward him. But her face, which she wanted to seem stern and determined, expressed only perplexity and suffering.

translation.ru: На краю болота и дороги мальчишки и мужики, стерегшие ночное, лежали и пред зарей все спали под кафтанами.
translation.en: At the edge of the marsh the peasant boys and men who had pastured their horses in the night lay, covered with their coats, having fallen asleep at daybreak.

translation.ru: -- Оттого, что вы всегда лучше всех.
translation.en: 'Because you must always be the belle of the ball.'

translation.ru: Мне все надо высказать.
translation.en: [But I shall not let you off anything!]

translation.ru: Что ж, папа, который себе почти ничего не оставил, будет помогать?
translation.en: Is Papa, who has kept scarcely anything for himself, to help us?...

translation.ru: -- Обещание дано было прежде. И я полагал, что вопрос о сыне решал дело.
translation.en: 'The promise was given before, and I thought the question about my son had settled the matter...

translation.ru: Люби кататься.....
translation.en: There's no joy without...'

translation.ru: Слава богу! -- проговорил он, шлепая по неубравшейся воде сбивавшеюся, полною воды ботинкой и подбегая к ним.
translation.en: Thank God!' he muttered, running up to them and splashing through the puddles with one shoe half off and full of water.

translation.ru: Левин разговорился с подавальщиком Федором об этой земле и спросил, не возьмет ли землю на будущий год Платон, богатый и хороший мужик той же деревни.
translation.en: Levin got into conversation with Theodore about that land, and asked whether Plato, a well-to-do. and worthy peasant of that village, would not rent that land next year.

translation.ru: А это-то и есть.
translation.en: And that is just how it is.

translation.ru: Все были хорошие, приятные.
translation.en: They were all good and pleasant.

translation.ru: Опять, как и в первую минуту, при известии об ее разрыве с мужем, Вронский, читая письмо, невольно отдался тому естественному впечатлению, которое вызывало в нем отношение к оскорбленному мужу.
translation.en: Again, as at the first moment when he heard the news of her having spoken to her husband, Vronsky yielded to the natural feeling produced by the thoughts of his relation to the injured husband.

translation.ru: Махая все так же косой, он маленьким, твердым шажком своих обутых в большие лапти ног влезал медленно на кручь и, хоть и трясся всем телом и отвисшими ниже рубахи портками, не пропускал на пути ни одной травинки, ни одного гриба и так же шутил с мужиками и Левиным.
translation.en: Swinging his scythe just as usual, taking short steps with feet shod in large bark-plaited shoes, he slowly climbed the slopes; and though his whole body and his loosely-hanging trousers shook, he did not miss a single mushroom or a curious grass, and continued joking with the other peasants and with Levin.

translation.en: 'Just fancy! We nearly ran over two soldiers,' she began at once, winking and smiling as she threw back her train which she had jerked too much to one side.

Ты такая чистота, что... -- Он взял ее руку и не поцеловал (целовать ее руку в этой близости смерти ему казалось непристойным), а только пожал ее с виноватым выражением, глядя в ее просветлевшие глаза.
translation.en: 'Yes, you see that woman Mary Nikolavna could not arrange all that,' said Levin. 'I... I must confess I am very, very glad you came. You are purity itself, and...' He took her hand and did not kiss it (to do so with death so near seemed to him unbecoming), but only pressed it, looking guiltily into her brightening eyes.

translation.en: He had only to remember his brother's wife and how that dear, excellent Varya at every opportunity showed him that she remembered his generosity and appreciated it, to realize the impossibility of withdrawing what he had given.

translation.en: It is just as if you had lost a child, and they kept on telling you: "Now he would have been so and so, and might be living and you rejoicing in him, but he is dead, dead, dead...!"-'

translation.en: 'Are they fully known?' intervened Koznyshev with a subtle smile. 'At present a purely classical education is regarded as the only real education, but we hear lively discussions from both sides and cannot deny that the opposite view has many arguments in its favour.'

translation.en: He went up to Madame Stahl, and spoke to her extremely politely and nicely in that excellent French which so very few people speak nowadays.

translation.en: There was only one possible and necessary way out of it, on which Vronsky decided without a moment's hesitation: to borrow ten thousand roubles from a money-lender, which he could easily do, to cut down his expenses, and to sell his racehorses.

translation.en: 'It means, it seems to me,' said Levin, beginning to get excited, 'that in a nation of eighty millions there can always be found not hundreds, as is now the case, but tens of thousands of men who have lost their social position, happy-go-lucky people who are always ready to go... into Pugachev's robber band [Pugachev was the leader of a very serious rebellion in the reign of Catherine the Great.] or to Khiva, or to Serbia...'

И с тем неуменьем, с тою нескладностью разговора, которые так знал Константин, он, опять оглядывая всех, стал рассказывать брату историю Крицкого: как его выгнали из университета за то, что он завел общество вспоможения бедным студентам и воскресные школы, и как потом он поступил в народную школу учителем, и как его оттуда также выгнали, и как потом судили за что-то.
translation.en: Seeing that the woman in the doorway was about to go out he shouted to her: 'Wait, I told you,' and in the awkward and blundering manner familiar to Constantine, he again looked round at everybody, and began to tell his brother about Kritsky: how he had been expelled from the University because he had started a society to help the poorer students, and also Sunday schools, and how he had afterwards taught in an elementary school, and had been turned out from that too, and had then been tried on some charge or other.

translation.en: Karenin smiled sadly, looked at his brother-in-law, and without replying went to the table and took from it an unfinished letter which he handed to him.

translation.ru: И, вновь перебрав условия дуэли, развода, разлуки и вновь отвергнув их, Алексей Александрович убедился, что выход был только один -- удержать ее при себе, скрыв от света случившееся и употребив все зависящие меры для прекращения связи и главное -- в чем самому себе он не признавался -- для наказания ее.
translation.en: And having reviewed the possibilities of a duel, of divorce, and of separation, and having again rejected them, Karenin came to the conclusion that there was only one course to be followed: to keep her with him, hiding from the world what had happened, and taking all necessary steps to put a stop to her love-affair, and above all (though he did not confess this to himself to punish her.
